cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 410 mi S of Bermuda and 975 mi ESE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest to northwest across the southwest Atlantic, aiming toward the North Carolina–South Carolina coastline then slowing and drifting inland toward southeastern Virginia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear, North Carolina (NC/SC border area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and Storm Surge Watches from Edisto Beach, SC to the North Carolina–Virginia border (Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds included)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Carolina, North Carolina, and eventually southeastern Virginia coasts
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Likely (3–5 ft possible at and just south of port)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely with a 70% chance; 20–30% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible if track shifts north
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft inundation possible along lower Chesapeake Bay and adjacent rivers if core passes just south
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 6–10+ inches, locally higher, leading to flash and river flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas, dangerous surf and rip currents, possible long-duration port closures and logistical disruptions
